snippet: Mary T. Barra, General Motors’ C.E.O., announced she was leading the company’s recall of 1.6 million vehicles to fix defective ignition switches.
abstract: General Motors chief executive Mary T Barra announces that she has personally taken charge of company's recall of 1.6 million vehicles to fix defective ignition switches; is Barra's first public acknowledgement of decade-long failure to address safety problems that have been linked to 13 deaths.
lead_paragraph: Mary T. Barra, General Motors’ C.E.O., announced she was leading the company’s recall of 1.6 million vehicles to fix defective ignition switches.

headline.main: G.M.’s Barra Promises to Investigate How Recall Was Handled
headline.print_headline: G.M.’s Chief, Barra, to Take Personal Control of Recall Effort
